Section.Catchline: Sale of assets in regular course of business and mortgage of assets.

Subsection.Text: A corporation may, on the terms and conditions and for the consideration determined by the board of directors:

Paragraph.Text: Sell, lease, exchange, or otherwise dispose of all, or substantially all, of its property in the usual and regular course of business;

Mortgage, pledge, dedicate to the repayment of indebtedness (whether with or without recourse), create a security interest in, or otherwise encumber any or all of its property whether or not in the usual and regular course of business; or
Transfer any or all of its property to a corporation all the shares of which are owned by the corporation.

Subsection.Text: Unless the articles of incorporation require it, approval by the shareholders of a transaction described in subsection (1) is not required.
